content.description: Once deciphered the route comes easy, but it is a bit hard to figure out.
content.location: Right side of Boyscout boulder, see photo.

content.description: Easier version of Feets of Contortion
content.location: Right streamside of Harley boulder.  Right of Feets of Contortion.

content.description: Start low on underclings to lockoffs to topout.
content.location: Across stream from "Boyscout" and "Indian Guides"Downhill from "Los Nuggets"

content.description: feels like your face is going to cheese grate the wall but your goodsolid top ledge
content.location: Across stream from "Boyscout" and "Indian Guides"Downhill from "Los nuggets"Left of "Thugged Out Since Cub Scouts"

content.description: Start on obvious right hand undercling-sidepull, and left hand on bad crimp. Bump left up to a good hold, proceed to the lip.
content.location: Pretty much in the river, downstream 20 yards of Perfect Sunday.

content.description: An extension to "Keep featherin it brother" aka "child support". Sit start about 5 feet lower down the rail and to the right of "keep featherin it" and climb into "keep featherin it". Quite an endurance test piece!
content.protection: A pad is nice to have at the crux of keep featherin it
content.location: Next to 8th of crack on the north side of the river

content.description: Start the same as Los nuggets, but finish by moving out right instead of going straight up.
content.protection: Can be covered with a pad or two
content.location: On the way to monkey swing, there should be a huge tree on your left before the drop in to bonsai, drop in to your right hand side and the boulder should be right there.

content.description: Very easy edge traverse route. Only about 10ft long. Top out.
content.protection: Bouldering. Crashpad probably not neccessary. Spotting encouraged for less experienced climbers.
content.location: About 20m (50ft) from the trail. Starts on the left most side of the edge.   GPS Location: 41°19'11.7"N 81°37'05.4"W

content.description: Start at arete with right hand on the right arete, and left hand on left facing sidepull. Get a heel hook on the right, and cross to the lip. Ride the lip left to "Rollout" on the slopey section of it.
content.location: On the Rollout Boulder on the park side of the river, downstream from the God Boulder, if you stand and touch a boulder with "HC" graffitied on it, the Rollout Boulder will be behind you.

content.description: Start at the left most crimps under the Rollout roof, with a far far left high foot. Traverse right keeping your feet in front of you. Just before rounding the arete, grab the lip and top out.
content.location: On the Rollout boulder. Downstream from the God Boulder, and directly behind the boulder with "HC" graffitied on it if you're standing by it.

content.description: Start low in deep pocket, move through intermediates to the crimp crack and high left crimp, deadpoint to lip. Topout is kinda spooky
content.location: 50 meters downstream from monkey swing on the cliff line

content.description: Start low and left matched on good rail; smear feet on and work holds to the right and set up for super fun dyno to top. WARNING: Ladder in picture is now broken therefore down climb is a bit more sketchy.
content.location: next face to the right of monkey swing roof

content.description: A very fun eliminate on the Poo Arete. Start the same as the V2, and avoid the Jug you usually dyno to, and instead go left on crimps and sloping ledges.
content.location: On the Poo Arete in the Monkey Swing area.

content.description: Start on campusing crimps to high top out.
content.location: Upstream on the 8th of crack cliff band.

content.description: Using the starting hold for Poo Arete and go straight up to the lip
content.location: Left of the arete of Poo Arete

content.description: Start on the obvious chalked jug, continue up and left through a pocket in a thin seam to the lip. CAREFULLY rock over the lip. Hike all the way up the slab to the top, and down climb off the back.
content.location: Just upstream of the Star arete, and downhill and slightly downstream of the Monkey Swing area. It's the biggest boulder you see.

content.description: start down and right on face, move left through slopers, and very crappy feet, right hand to good roof rail, match and go right to sloper lip, continue one move right and mantle up
content.location: Monkey Swing Roof Lat/Long: 41.322172, -81.615745

content.description:
Sit start, climb directly up the arete.

 Really nice climb- juggy and overhung. Crux is the endurance required to top out, as this is a long route.

 Friendly reminder to wipe your shoes thoroughly before getting on any boulder! The ground beneath this boulder is rather muddy and the starting foot holds are caked with mud.

climbchippewa.com/problem/m…
content.protection: 1-2 pads, spotter strongly suggested as there is a large boulder in the fall zone.
content.location: West of Los Nuggets; prominent boulder just south of the main trail.Gps: 41.321528,-81.617843

content.description: Sit start on 2 crimpy edges, go straight up.
content.location: Chalked up boulder south of 8th of crack.

content.description: Start on the low rail to the lower right. Work your way up the lip and traverse left to the obvious left crimp. From there work your way to the top
content.location: Same Boulder as Hallucinogenics. The problem starts and tops out to the right of Hallucinogenics

content.description: Start on the left side slopey crimps, traverse right to the prow and top out.
content.location: About 5 feet downhill from the Bonsai Boulder, uphill from the Arrow Boulder.

climbs.name: Keep featherin it, brother
climbs.fa: Possibly but some old head will claim it was climbed in the 60’s so who cares

content.description: Fun slopey/crimp traverse line on the 8th of crack Boulder.
content.location: Starts with the two best crimps and traverses left in to the end of 8th of crack.

content.description: Climb right arête
content.location: Right next to the arrow

content.description: The double handed sloper matchLeft handed crimp jug to top
content.location: Down stream from “Boyscout”Directly across river from “Thugged Out Since Cub Scouts”

content.description: Start the same as "A Summertime Christmas", but traverse out left on sloping ledges. Continue up to the top on more slopers. Could use traffic, but it will clean up nicely.
content.location: On the back side of the warm up boulder in the Monkey Swing Area.

content.description: Crouch start with your left hand in a good slot/crimp/rail down in the roof and your right hand on a bad undercling crimp near the lip. Work your right hand up the arete, find your footing, climb up and top out. FA by Dave Schultz in March of 2019
content.protection: Pads. Biffing the topout and rolling down the hill could be bad.
content.location: South side of the river, downstream, uphill from the egg and star arete. All the way up the hill by the fence, but below the trail.

content.description: To the right of Thugged Out Since Cub Scouts.  Starts under a low roof and climbs out and straight up small crimps.
content.location: Across stream from "Boyscout" and "Indian Guides"Downhill from "Los nuggets"Right of "Thugged Out Since Cub Scouts"

content.description: Sit start of Hypocrite V9. The key differences between this and "Hypocrite" V9 are that you start with your butt on the ground, and neither hand starts in the good left hand start hold for the Original Hypocrite. There are some crimps down and to the left of the good start hold to the V9 that I started on.
content.location: South side of the river, uphil from the egg, but below the fence from the main trail.

content.description: Start on the first right hand of Los Nuggets. Traverse right to a small ledge, bring the left hand into a pinch, then throw to the arete. Follow the arete to a top out.
content.location: Same boulder as Los Nuggets.

content.description: Start on the two holds down in the crack and work your way up To the mail slot. Then stand and smear to the top.
content.location: The problem is right next to star across the river.

content.description: Start at the obvious jug down in the little cave. Climb up and out to a moderately tall but easy top out.
content.location: Right of the Poo Arete on the same cliff line, in a little cave. In the Monkey Swing Area.

content.description: Start low on jugs on far left side of boulder and move up to a slabby topout.
content.location: Streamside of harley boulder.

content.description: SDS left hand on thin undercling, right hand on arete. bump right hand up arete and hope you have good foot work and core strength to keep yo feet on, left hand throws out to the flat corner of boulder, keep compression and launch for the lip with your left hand. top out
content.location: Across from the Arrow head boulder

content.description: Start on left hand undercling then move up sparse crimps to large lock off move to the top crimp
content.location: monkey swing area

content.description: Same start as "hallucinogens", but move out right to the lip, then work your way up the slab.
content.protection: A pad or two, and a spotter
content.location: across the stream from star arete and perfect sunday. It's the large slab face with the mail slot in the center.

content.description: Climb the little slab on the back of the Bonsai boulder. Easy but would be crimpy and technical for a newbie.
content.location: On the back of Bonsai.

content.description: Start with right hand on corner of the arete where there should be a crimp, and the left hand on the obvious pinch in the center. Work you way through both aretes to a juggy topout. The starting foot may have to be dug out, as it can get washed over with sand.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter.
content.location: About 100 yards upstream of the egg.

content.description: Start low on crimps to throw out to jug on arete to topout.
content.location: Boulder across from Harley boulder.

content.description: Starts the same as "The Arrow of Light", but eventually bumps out to the indent feature of the left side. Finish by riding both aretes in a compression to the top. May be harder for people under 5ft. 7.
content.protection: Pads, maybe a spotter to feel extra safe.
content.location: On the Arrow boulder, across the river from the egg, almost directly West of Plans to Commit Arson, and near Thugged out since Cub Scouts. The obvious arrow shaped boulder near facing the creek.

content.description: Work your way up the left side arete of the boulder using the obvious incut feature in the middle to start on.
content.location: Across the creek from the Egg, or follow the trail from Bonsi down to the creek. Obvious arrow shaped boulder facing the creek.

content.description: Split start with right hand just below crescent shaped indent on the right arete, and left hand on a poor slopey ledge low on the face. Work up the right arete using the obivous slopy crimp in the center of the boulder near the top.
content.protection: Pads, and maybe a spotter to make sure the climber stays on the landing zone.
content.location: On the Arrow boulder, across the river from the egg, almost directly West of Plans to Commit Arson, and near Thugged out since Cub Scouts. The obvious arrow shaped boulder near facing the creek.

content.description: Sit Start with hands jammed in vertical crack big move out to overhanging crack to top out.
content.location:
Uphill from harley boulder. 

  GPS Coordinates: GPS: 41.322071, -81.615937

content.description: Crux is pulling on, top is a bit scary
content.location: Right side of Boyscout boulder, start on the sand and rock beach traverse out over the river and jaunt up the arete.

content.description: Start on the lowest flat sloped ledge. Continue up  blocky slopers to top out. A bit dirty, and could use some traffic, but fun movement!
content.location: On the backside of the warmup boulder in the Monkey Swing Area.

content.description: The crux is the top, a small hop that is committing given the less than perfect landing.
content.location: See photo, on Boyscout boulder.

content.description: Downstream from the drop in..
